thread.title: Autopsy results revealed in Tyler Sash’s death
thread.title_full: Autopsy results revealed in Tyler Sash’s death

title: Autopsy results revealed in Tyler Sash’s death
text:
Autopsy results revealed in Tyler Sash’s death UPDATED 12:13 PM CDT Oct 13, 2015 
The Iowa Department of Public Health released the findings of an autopsy in the death of former Hawkeye and New York Giants football player, Tyler Sash, on Tuesday. Other Stories Halloween 2015: Beggars' night list 
The Iowa Office of the State Medical Examiner said Sash died due to "an accidental mixed drug toxicity involving methadone and hydrocodone." 
A recent shoulder dislocation and a history of chronic shoulder pain were also significant conditions, according to the medical examiner. 
According to the release, additional studies for chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), a degenerative disease of the brain found in athletes with a history of repetitive brain trauma, are pending and will be completed in approximately eight to twelve months. 
Sash was found dead in his home in Oskaloosa Sept. 8. 
Sash, 27, played for head coach Kirk Ferentz at Iowa from 2008 to 2010 and was a member of the 2011 and 2012 New York Giants. He was drafted in the sixth round in 2011 and won a Super Bowl with the Giants. Tags Tyler Sash death autopsy results iowa sports news 
MOLLIE: TOXICOLOGY TESTS HAVE BEEN RELEASED IN FORMER IOWA STANDOUT AND NFL PLAYER TYLER SASH. GOOD AFTERNOON. THANKS FOR JOINING US. SASH WAS FOUND DEAD IN HIS OSKALOOSA HOME ON SEPTEMBER 8TH. AN AUTOPSY THE NEXT DAY REVEALED NO TRAUMA. AND NOW, THE STATE MEDICAL EXAMINER CONFIRMS THAT THE CAUSE OF DEATH WAS AN ACCIDENTAL OVERDOSE. THE REPORT RELEASED EARLIER THIS MORNING SAYS SASHS' DEATH WAS CAUSED BY "AN ACCIDENTAL MIXED DRUG TOXICITY INVOLVING METHADONE AND HYDROCODONE, ALSO KNOWN AS VICODIN." THE REPORT ALSO SAYS A RECENT SHOULDER DISLOCATION AND A HISTORY OF CHRONIC SHOULDER PAIN WERE FACTORS. THE CORNER ALSO SAYS ADDITIONAL STUDIES FOR CTE, A DEGENERATIVE DISEASE OF THE BRAIN FOUND IN ATHLETES WITH A HISTORY OF REPETITIVE BRAIN TRAUMA, ARE PENDING AND WILL BE COMPLETED IN EIGHT TO TWELVE MONTHS. SASH DID HAVE A HISTORY OF CONCUSSIONS WHILE PLAYING FOR BOTH IOWA AND THE NEW YORK GIANTS OF THE NFL. LOOK FOR MUCH MORE ON THIS STORY
